sen.j: 二条 斉通（にじょう なりみち、天明元年5月9日 (旧暦)（1781年5月31日） - 寛政10年5月21日 (旧暦)（1798年7月4日））は江戸時代の公卿。
sen.e: Narimichi NIJO (May 31, 1781 - July 4, 1798) was kugyo (high court noble) in the Edo period.
Narimichi NIJO (May 31, 1781 - July 4, 1798) was kugyo (high court noble) in the Edo period.
Narimichi NIJO (May 31, 1781 - July 4, 1798) was kugyo (high court noble) in the Edo period.
His father was Harutaka NIJO.
His father was Harutaka NIJO.
His father was Harutaka NIJO.

sen.j: 母は徳川宗翰女・嘉姫。
sen.e: His mother was Yoshihime (嘉姫) (daughter of Munemoto TOKUGAWA).
sen.cmt: 嘉姫の読み不明徳川宗翰の読み<http://www.asahi-net.or.jp/~me4k-skri/han/kantou/mito.html>を参照
sen.e: His mother was Yoshihime (嘉姫) (daughter of Munemoto TOKUGAWA).
His mother was Yoshihime (嘉姫) (daughter of Munemoto TOKUGAWA).
His court official rank was Junii (Junior Second Rank).
His court official rank was Junii (Junior Second Rank).

His alias was Kyotokuin (恭徳院).
His alias was Kyotokuin (恭徳院).

sen.j: 天明元年（1781年）に二条治孝の子として京に生まれる。
sen.e: He was born to Harutaka NIJO in Kyoto in 1781.
He was born to Harutaka NIJO in Kyoto in 1781.
He was born to Harutaka NIJO in Kyoto in 1781.

sen.j: 寛政3年（1791年）2月22日 (旧暦)、叙従三位。
sen.e: He was appointed to Jusanmi (Junior Third Rank) on February 22, 1791 (old calendar).
He was appointed to Jusanmi (Junior Third Rank) on February 22, 1791 (old calendar).
He was appointed to Jusanmi (Junior Third Rank) on February 22, 1791 (old calendar).

sen.j: 内大臣（1797年 - 1798年）などを歴任。
sen.e: He held various posts such as Naidaijin (Minister of the Center) (1797 - 1798).
He held various posts such as Naidaijin (Minister of the Center) (1797 - 1798).
He held various posts such as Naidaijin (Minister of the Center) (1797 - 1798).
He died in 1798.
